creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund
department: Art of Africa and the Americas
description: rattle in the form of a man; arms upraised, fingers incised, scroll in each palm; the figure wears a short tunic, heavy breastplate, bracelets, and disk earrings; formal headdress; plain back; four pierced holes, two in front and two in back for rattle sounds; figure made from mould
object_name: Rattle in the form of a Dignitary
title: Rattle in the form of a Dignitary
